Specific Details: Presentation of SSE’s ambitions to fully develop Arklow Bank Wind Park to the Executive and Members of Wicklow County Council at the authority's September monthly meeting.
DPOs Lobbied: Frank Curran|Chief Executive Officer|Wicklow County Council::Pat Vance|Councillor|Wicklow County Council::Pat Fitzgerald|Councillor|Wicklow County Council::Steven Matthews|Councillor|Wicklow County Council::Sylvester Bourke|Councillor|Wicklow County Council::Jennifer Whitmore|Councillor|Wicklow County Council::Gerry Walsh|Councillor|Wicklow County Council::Vincent Blake|Councillor|Wicklow County Council::Shay Cullen|Councillor|Wicklow County Council::John Snell|Councillor|Wicklow County Council::Gail Dunne|Councillor|Wicklow County Council::John Ryan|Councillor|Wicklow County Council::Pat Kennedy|Councillor|Wicklow County Council
Subject Matter: Presentation of SSE’s ambitions to fully develop Arklow Bank Wind Park to the Executive and Members of Wicklow County Council at the authority's September monthly meeting.
Intended Results: Presentation to outline SSE’s ambitions to fully develop Arklow Bank Wind Park and the policy measures needed to enable the development, including design of grid connections regime and Renewable Electricity Support Scheme. SSE outlined how the expansion of the offshore wind energy sector  represents a new and significant economic opportunity for County Wicklow, including the potential jobs and community benefit that Arklow Bank can bring to the region.
Lobbying Activities: Presentation to Wicklow County Council at County Buildings, Wicklow Town|Meeting|1
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Murdo McGhie,  Marian Troy, Jason Cooke

Specific Details: Ms. Croce (Executive Director) contacted Cllr. Peir Leonard, Cllr. Jennifer Whitmore, Cllr. Mary Kavanagh in order to close down a small section of coastline called Lime Kiln Beach in Co. Wicklow. This location is an important seal pupping and moulting site and is of direct scientific interest.
DPOs Lobbied: Mary Kavanagh|Councillor|Wicklow County Council::Peir Leonard|Councillor|Wicklow County Council::Jennifer Whitmore|Councillor|Wicklow County Council
Subject Matter: Ms. Croce (Executive Director) contacted Cllr. Peir Leonard, Cllr. Jennifer Whitmore, Cllr. Mary Kavanagh in order to close down a small section of coastline called Lime Kiln Beach in Co. Wicklow. This location is an important seal pupping and moulting site and is of direct scientific interest.
Intended Results: Public closure of Lime Kiln Beach in Co. Wicklow for duration of seal pupping and moulting season (August - April). This has direct and valuable scientific interest and has become a well-known tourist activity near Wicklow Town. This closure benefits public health and safety, tourism and international research efforts.::Create international research potential through seal identification research project, which links into database with Cornwall Seal Research Trust an other rescue centres across Europe.
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Melanie Croce, Executive Director of Seal Rescue Ireland

Specific Details: The Need for a Global Green Deal to be adopted by the EU and for support for local Fairtrade initiatives in local authority areas.
DPOs Lobbied: Barry Andrews|MEP|European Parliament::Billy Kelleher|MEP|European Parliament::Chris MacManus|MEP|European Parliament::Ciarán Cuffe|MEP|European Parliament::Clare Daly|MEP|European Parliament::Grace O'Sullivan|MEP|European Parliament::Luke Ming Flanagan|MEP|European Parliament::Mick Wallace|MEP|European Parliament::Seán Kelly|MEP|European Parliament::Bríd Smith|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Aodhán Ó Ríordáin|MEP|European Parliament::Jennifer Whitmore|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: The Need for a Global Green Deal to be adopted by the EU and for support for local Fairtrade initiatives in local authority areas.
Intended Results:
“Fair Trade Agreements” that put people and the environment together with business and profit.

Fair Access To Climate Finance: MEPs can ensure international climate finance is scaled up to meet the climate crises 


    Fair Access To Climate Finance: MEPs can ensure international climate finance is scaled up to meet the climate crises and that support moves towards agroecology, to support more sustainable business practices, and help to transform trade for people and planet.
Lobbying Activities: We encouraged the public to Vote Fairtrade and for a Global Green deal when considering who they voted for. |Social Media|31-50
Grassroots directive: We are encouraging our supporters to write to the Local Authority and EU Parliament candidates and to get their support for a Global Green Deal. Candidates could also sign our Vote Fairtrade Banner and then to put their pictures up on social media.
